greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, and for n > 1, a(n) = A276085(A327963(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2048
formula: a(A327929(n)) = A327929(n) for all n. [But note that there are also other fixed points.]
program: A276086(n) = { my(i=0,m=1,pr=1,nextpr); while((n>0),i=i+1; nextpr = prime(i)*pr; if((n%nextpr),m*=(prime(i)^((n%nextpr)/pr));n-=(n%nextpr));pr=nextpr); m; };
xref: Cf. A327929 (a subsequence of fixed points).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 07 2019
